qas.question: What were the last days of the Qing dynasty marked by?
What did the Qing dynasty attempt to do n the face of civil unrest?

answers.text: attempt to reform the government in various

qas.question: What happened to The reformers in the Qing dynasty?
What caused the revolution against the Qing dynasty?

answers.text: failures of the Imperial Court to enact such reforming measures of political liberalization and modernization

context: The last days of the Qing Dynasty were marked by <a0_0>civil unrest and foreign invasions.<a0_0/> Responding to these civil failures and discontent, the Qing Imperial Court did <a1_0>attempt to reform the government in various<a1_0/> ways, such as the decision to draft a constitution in 1906, the establishment of provincial legislatures in 1909, and the preparation for a national parliament in 1910. However, many of these measures were opposed by the conservatives of the Qing Court, and many reformers were <a2_0>either imprisoned or executed outright.<a2_0/> The <a3_0>failures of the Imperial Court to enact such reforming measures of political liberalization and modernization<a3_0/> caused the reformists to steer toward the road of revolution.
